sub_topic: Finding the projection of one vector onto another using trigonometry
message_1: A force vector F of magnitude 20 N is acting at an angle of 30 degrees to a displacement vector D. Find the projection of the force vector F onto the displacement vector D.
message_2:
To find the projection of the force vector F onto the displacement vector D, we can use the formula:

Projection = |F| * cos(θ)

where |F| is the magnitude of the force vector (20 N), and θ is the angle between the force vector and the displacement vector (30 degrees).

First, we need to convert the angle from degrees to radians:

θ = 30 degrees * (π / 180) = π / 6 radians

Now, we can find the projection:

Projection = 20 N * cos(π / 6) = 20 N * (√3 / 2) = 10√3 N

So, the projection of the force vector F onto the displacement vector D is 10√3 N.
